description: Borrowed from Ancient Greek πένταθλον (péntathlon), from πέντε (pénte, “five”) + ἆθλον (âthlon, “contest”).

entries.meaning: An ancient athletics discipline, featuring five events: stadion, wrestling, long jump, javelin and discus
examples: Synonyms: ancient pentathlon, Greek pentathlon, ancient Greek pentathlon

entries.meaning: (athletics) Ellipsis of women's pentathlon.; A 20th-century athletics discipline for women, the women's counterpart of the men's decathlon, the predecessor to the women's heptathlon, featuring five events: hurdles, shot put, high jump, long jump, and a run
(athletics) Ellipsis of modern pentathlon.; a discipline with five events based on late-19th century basic military skills
